result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Rosa-Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Restitution to be paid to Rodolfo G-I in the amount of $500.00. To be taken from cash bail on deposit.

With credit for 54 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Court ordered a $1,000.00 fine PLUS costs, fees, any assessments and surcharges. To be taken from cash bail. Any amount due and owing, due by 07-11-2016 or civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample

JOC Corrected-restitution amount was incorrect.

Defendant Anthony J Rosa-Rivera in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court sentences defendant to serve 54 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 54 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered restitution be paid to Rudolfo G-I in the amount of $500.00 to be taken from cash bail on deposit.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered a $1000.00 fine plus costs, fees, any assessments and surcharges to be taken from cash bail.  Any amount due and owing by 7/11/2016 or civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief  and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Anthony J Rosa-Rivera in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defense motion to modify bail argued and denied  by the Court. Bail: $2500.00 cash to remain

Defendant Anthony J Rosa-Rivera in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wis. Stats. sec. 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony J Rosa-Rivera in court.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/23/15 @ 1:30 pm
